    General usage Worked examples

Delimit groups in morphospace

Source: R/mspace_workflow.R
proj_groups.Rd

Project convex hulls ennclosing a priori groups into an existing morphospace.

Usage

proj_groups(mspace, shapes = NULL, groups, pipe = TRUE, ...)

Arguments

mspace

An "mspace" object.

shapes

Optional shapes data.

groups

Factor; classification of observations into groups.

pipe

Logical; is the function being included in a pipe?

...

Further arguments passed to hulls_by_group_2D().

Value

If a plot device with a morphospace is open, convex hulls enclosing the scores corresponding to groups are projected into morphospace. If pipe = TRUE the supplied mspaceobject will be modified by adding a new $gr_class slot, and returned invisibly.

Details

The purpose of this function is to add a classification for shapes populating the morphospace to mspace objects during pipeline, as well as to facilitate group visualization. Otherwise, it is just a wrapper for hulls_by_group_2D.

See also

hulls_by_group_2D

Examples

#load and extract relevant data, packages and information
library(magrittr)
data("shells")
shapes <- shells$shapes
species <- shells$data$species
sp_shapes <- consensus(shapes, species)

#generate basic morphospace, add sampled shapes and convex hulls for species
mspace(shapes, links = links, mag = 0.7, axes = c(1,2), bg.model = "light gray") %>%
  proj_shapes(shapes = shapes, col = c(1:4)[species], pch = 1) %>%
  proj_groups(groups = species, col = 1:4, lwd = 2)
